results.title: The Legend of Hell House
results.brief_description: A physicist and his wife, along with a young psychic and the only survivor of a previous visit to the notorious Hell House set out to prove life after death and solve the mystery of the haunted house.

constellations_other.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_other.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

results.description: A team consisting of a physicist, his wife, a young female psychic and the only survivor of the previous visit are sent to the notorious Hell House to prove/disprove survival after death. Previous visitors have either been killed or gone mad, and it is up to the team to survive a full week in isolation, and solve the mystery of the Hell House.
description_for_label: A team consisting of a physicist, his wife, a young female psychic and the only survivor of the previous visit are sent to the notorious Hell House to prove/disprove survival after death. Previous visitors have either been killed or gone mad, and it is up to the team to survive a full week in isolation, and solve the mystery of the Hell House.

results.title: The Learning Tree
results.creator_credit: Edward D. Engoron, Winger and Gordon Parks
results.brief_description: The story, set in Kansas during the 1920’s, covers less than a year in the life of a black teenager, and documents the veritable deluge of events which force him into sudden manhood. The family relationships and enmities, the fears, frustrations and ambitions of the black teenager in small-town America are explored with a strong statement about human values.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward D. Engoron, Winger and Gordon Parks
results.description: The story, set in Kansas during the 1920’s, covers less than a year in the life of a black teenager, and documents the veritable deluge of events which force him into sudden manhood. The family relationships and enmities, the fears, frustrations and ambitions of the black teenager in small-town America are explored with a strong statement about human values.

results.title: The Lawnmower Man
results.creator_credit: Gimel Everett, Brett Leonard, Alex McDowell and Allied Vision
results.headline_credit: Japan, United Kingdom, United States and United States of America, 1992
results.brief_description: A brilliant scientist, obsessed with perfecting a revolutionary virtual reality software program, enlists the aid of a slow-witted gardener, only to encounter a shadowy group seeking to turn the “lawnmower man” into the ultimate weapon.

constellations_other.name: VR dreams
constellations_other.description: Since VR's inception creators have explored the ways VR could be used to enhance our lives and even extend them.

results.headline_credit_for_label: Japan, United Kingdom, United States and United States of America, 1992
results.description: A simple man is turned into a genius through the application of computer science.
description_for_label: A simple man is turned into a genius through the application of computer science.

results.title: The Last Days of Chez Nous
results.brief_description: The story of sisters Vicki and Beth, when Vicki begins an affair with Beth’s intriguing French husband.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.description: The story of sisters Vicki and Beth, when Vicki begins an affair with Beth’s intriguing French husband.

results.title: The Killing Fields
results.creator_credit: Enigma Productions, International Film Investors, Roy Walker, Roland Joffé, Bruce Robinson, David Puttnam and Judy Moorcroft
results.brief_description: The real-life story of a friendship between two journalists, an American and a Cambodian, during the bloody Khmer Rouge takeover of Cambodia in 1975, which led to the death of 2-3 million Cambodians during the next four years, until Pol Pot’s regime was toppled by the intervening Vietnamese in 1979.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Enigma Productions, International Film Investors, Roy Walker, Roland Joffé, Bruce Robinson, David Puttnam and Judy Moorcroft

results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.creator_credit: Lydia Tanji, Ronald Bass, Patrick Markey, Amy Tan, Wayne Wang and Donald Graham Burt
results.headline_credit: China, United States and United States of America, 1993
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, The Joy Luck Club tells the story of two generations of Chinese women and spans from feudal China to modern America while highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lydia Tanji, Ronald Bass, Patrick Markey, Amy Tan, Wayne Wang and Donald Graham Burt
results.headline_credit_for_label: China, United States and United States of America, 1993
results.description: Through a series of flashbacks, four Chinese women born in America and their respective mothers born in feudal China explore their pasts.
description_for_label: Through a series of flashbacks, four Chinese women born in America and their respective mothers born in feudal China explore their pasts.

results.title: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
results.brief_description: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. During interviews with filmmaker Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years.

constellations_other.name: Presumption of guilt
constellations_other.description: A Constellation looking at true crime documentaries, the nature of innocence and prejudice.

results.title_for_label: The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst
results.description: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. Brilliant, reclusive, and the subject of relentless media scrutiny, he’s never spoken publicly—until now. During interviews with Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years. In 2010, Jarecki made the narrative film All Good Things based on the infamous story of Robert Durst. After Durst saw the film, he contacted Jarecki wanting to tell his story. What began as a feature documentary ultimately became a six-part series as more and more of his incredible story was revealed.
description_for_label: Robert Durst, scion of one of New York’s billionaire real estate families, has been accused of three murders but never convicted. Brilliant, reclusive, and the subject of relentless media scrutiny, he’s never spoken publicly—until now. During interviews with Andrew Jarecki, he reveals secrets of the case that baffled authorities for 30 years. In 2010, Jarecki made the narrative film All Good Things based on the infamous story of Robert Durst. After Durst saw the film, he contacted Jarecki wanting to tell his story. What began as a feature documentary ultimately became a six-part series as more and more of his incredible story was revealed.

results.title: The Jazz Singer
results.brief_description: The Jazz Singer is a 1927 American musical drama film directed by Alan Crosland. It is the first feature-length motion picture with not only a synchronised recorded music score but also lip-synchronous singing and speech in several isolated sequences.

constellations_other.name: Oh, no! Beta!
constellations_other.description: The Sony Betacam BVP-3P was a broadcast-quality camera that used Sony's Beta system, most commonly found in consumer cameras. During the Format Wars in the 1970s and 80s, Beta lost to the cheaper and more accessible Video Home System (VHS).

constellations_other.name: Sound and Hollywood
constellations_other.description: The impact of sound on Tinsel Town stretches from the beginning of cinema to recent award-winners, as well as the biggest band in K-Pop.

results.description: A young Jewish man is torn between tradition and individuality when his old-fashioned family objects to his career as a jazz singer. This is the first full length feature film to use synchronized sound, and is the original film musical.
description_for_label: A young Jewish man is torn between tradition and individuality when his old-fashioned family objects to his career as a jazz singer. This is the first full length feature film to use synchronized sound, and is the original film musical.

results.title: The Invisible Man
results.brief_description: The Invisible Man is a 1933 American pre-Code science fiction horror film directed by James Whale. Based on H. G. Wells’ 1897 science fiction novel The Invisible Man and produced by Universal Pictures, the film stars Claude Rains, in his first American screen appearance, - WIKI
results.description: Working in Dr. Cranley’s laboratory, scientist Jack Griffin was always given the latitude to conduct some of his own experiments. His sudden departure, however, has Cranley’s daughter Flora worried about him. Griffin has taken a room at the nearby Lion’s Head Inn, hoping to reverse an experiment he conducted on himself that made him invisible. But the experimental drug has also warped his mind, making him aggressive and dangerous. He’s prepared to do whatever it takes to restore his appearance.
description_for_label: Working in Dr. Cranley’s laboratory, scientist Jack Griffin was always given the latitude to conduct some of his own experiments. His sudden departure, however, has Cranley’s daughter Flora worried about him. Griffin has taken a room at the nearby Lion’s Head Inn, hoping to reverse an experiment he conducted on himself that made him invisible. But the experimental drug has also warped his mind, making him aggressive and dangerous. He’s prepared to do whatever it takes to restore his appearance.

results.title: The Innocent Man
results.brief_description: In a story that gained national attention with John Grisham’s best-selling non-fiction book on the subject, the documentary series The Innocent Man focuses on two murders that shook the small town of Ada, Oklahoma, in the 1980s — and the controversial events that followed.

constellations_other.name: Presumption of guilt
constellations_other.description: A Constellation looking at true crime documentaries, the nature of innocence and prejudice.

results.description: In a story that gained national attention with John Grisham’s best-selling non-fiction book, The Innocent Man: Murder and Injustice in a Small Town, the six-part documentary series The Innocent Man focuses on two murders that shook the small town of Ada, Oklahoma, in the 1980s — and the controversial chain of events that followed.
description_for_label: In a story that gained national attention with John Grisham’s best-selling non-fiction book, The Innocent Man: Murder and Injustice in a Small Town, the six-part documentary series The Innocent Man focuses on two murders that shook the small town of Ada, Oklahoma, in the 1980s — and the controversial chain of events that followed.
